hints.content:

641: The symmetries established in Chapter 9 have exact discrete analogues in the Fractal Set:
642: 
643: | **Symmetry** | **Layer 3 (Ch 9)** | **Layer 2 (Ch 12)** | **Layer 1 (This Ch)** | **Convergence** |
644: |--------------|-------------------|---------------------|----------------------|-----------------|
645: | **Permutation** | $S_N$ | Gauge group $S_N$ | Episode relabeling $S_{\|\mathcal{E}\|}$ | {prf:ref}`thm-discrete-permutation-invariance-discrete-sym` |
646: | **Translation** | $T_a$ (Thm 9.2.2) | Config space symmetry | $T_a$-invariance ({prf:ref}`thm-discrete-translation-equivariance-discrete-sym`) | Exact |
647: | **Rotation** | $SO(d)$ (Thm 9.2.3) | Braid group $B_N$ | Plaquette symmetry | {prf:ref}`cor-discrete-rotational-equivariance-discrete-sym` |
648: | **Time-reversal** | Broken (Thm 9.2.5) | CST acyclicity | No timelike loops | {prf:ref}`conj-connection-to-braid-holonomy-discrete-sym` |

hints.label: unlabeled-remark-28
hints.title: Emergence of Continuous Symmetries
hints.content:
666: :class: note
667: 
668: **Bottom-up perspective**: The Fractal Set is the **primary object** (discrete, finite, algorithmically generated). Continuous symmetries (diffeomorphisms, gauge transformations) emerge in the $N \to \infty$ limit via:
669: 
670: 1. **Episode density**: As $N$ increases, episodes densify in spacetime → discrete graph approaches continuum manifold
671: 2. **Symmetry inheritance**: Discrete permutation symmetry $S_{|\mathcal{E}|}$ restricts to walker permutation $S_N$ → continuous exchangeability
672: 3. **Gauge connection**: Discrete holonomy ({prf:ref}`def-discrete-gauge-connection-discrete-sym`) converges to continuous gauge connection (Chapter 12)
